purpose: The email is a call for participation in the EASE'25 conference, which will take place from June 17-20, 2025. It invites researchers and practitioners to present and discuss their work related to empirical evaluation in software engineering. The conference will feature keynotes from notable speakers and various tracks for research papers, including industry and doctoral tracks. Registration details are provided, along with information about workshops scheduled for June 17th.

infos:
Subject: Call for Participation (Main Conference + Workshops): EASE'25: 29th International Conference on Evaluation and Assessment in Software Engineering, June 17-20, 2025
From: SEWORLD Moderator <[log in to unmask]>
Reply-To:SEWORLD Moderator <[log in to unmask]>
Date:Sat, 17 May 2025 12:32:01 -0000
Content-Type:text/plain
Call for Participation (Main Conference + Workshops): EASE'25: 29th International Conference on Evaluation and Assessment in Software Engineering, June 17-20, 2025

The International Conference on Evaluation and Assessment in Software Engineering (EASE) provides a stimulating forum where researchers and practitioners can present and discuss recent research results on a wide range of topics within empirical evaluation of software engineering technologies, practices, and tools; transferring and applying empirical research methods from other disciplines to empirical software engineering and reflections on the use of such methods.
Sven Apel, Saarland University, AI4SE: Adventures in the Promised Land, June 18, 2025
Brian Fitzgerald, Lero - the Irish Software Research Centre, The Rise and Rise of InnerSource, June 19, 2025
Conference registration can be accessed from the following link:
On June 17th, EASE will feature the following five workshops
